docs.snippet: The United States shipped $83,928,000 more merchandise to Japan, including re-exports, in the first eleven months of 1937 than in the corresponding period of 1936, according to a report today by the Department of Commerce, supplementing total trade...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States shipped $83,928,000 more merchandise to Japan, including re-exports, in the first eleven months of 1937 than in the corresponding period of 1936, according to a report today by the Department of Commerce, supplementing total trade figures previously made public. The new figures give imports and exports by countries.

headline.main: TRADE WITH JAPAN TOOK SPURT IN 1937; Gain of $83,928,000 in Exports and $37,070,000 in Imports Recorded in 11 Months CHINA'S SHOWS RISE ALSO Commerce Department Report Sees Asia Displacing Europe as Principal Shipper

docs.snippet: An Argentine Army plane carrying the son of Argentina's President and five army officers was reported today to have crashed near the Uruguayan boundary, seriously injuring three of its occupants.

docs.snippet: Eduardo Justo, the younger of President Agustin P. Justo's two sons, and eight others were killed last night when an army plane crashed in Uruguay on its way back to Buenos Aires after a ceremony at Uruguayana, Brazil, where President Justo and...
docs.lead_paragraph: Eduardo Justo, the younger of President Agustin P. Justo's two sons, and eight others were killed last night when an army plane crashed in Uruguay on its way back to Buenos Aires after a ceremony at Uruguayana, Brazil, where President Justo and President Getulio Dornelles Vargas of Brazil had inaugurated work on a new international bridge across the Uruguay River.
docs.abstract: gets news of son's death on return

headline.main: JUSTO'S SON AND 8 DIE IN PLANE CRASH; Army Craft Is Wrecked in Uruguay After Missing Its Course in Storm
